name: sodium ethyl xanthate production | sodium ethyl xanthate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25918/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg pure sodium ethyl xanthate (CAS 140-90-9) from carbon disulfide. Sodium ethyl xanthate is a pale yellow powder at standard conditions.;Sodium ethyl xanthate is used mainly in the mining industry as flotation agent for recovery of metals as copper, nickel, silver or gold, as well as solid metal sulfides or oxides from ore slurries. Furthermore, it is used as defoliant, herbicide, and an additive to rubber to protect it against oxygen and ozone.;Sodium ethyl xanthate showed a moderat toxicity through oral and dermal intake in animals and is irritating to eyes and skin. It is especially toxic to aquatic life and therefore its disposal is strictly controlled.;Sodium ethyl xanthate is produced from carbon disulfide, ethanol and sodium hydroxide:;CH3CH2OH + CS2 + NaOH --> CH3CH2OCS2Na + H2O;References:;Kunene, M. C. (2014): Life cycle assessment of the production of xanthate salts and of their application for ARD mitigation, University of Cape Town;GENDORF Chemical Park

The activity includes all the raw and processed materials necessary to produce this product.

The activity ends with the final product being ready for transportation at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: South African data, collected monthly average in 2011, average data.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Sodium ethyl xanthate is produced from carbon disulfide, ethanol and sodium hydroxide. The production is essentially carried out in a batch system.;CH3CH2OH + CS2 + NaOH --> CH3CH2OCS2Na + H2O;The process is usually carried out in two steps:;1. CH3CH2OH + NaOH --> CH3CH2ONa + H2O;Excess of precooled alcohol is added to the reactor and sodium hydroxide is added slowly. Since the reaction is exothermic, is has to be cooled continously by cooling water.;2. CH3CH2ONa + CS2 --> CH2CH2OCS2Na;Carbon disulfide is added under continued refrigeration.;Emissions from the xanthate plant are reported to be negligible as neither the solid nor the liquid plants generate solid or liquid effluents. All non-product outputs are returned to the process for conversion to xanthate.;Reference:;Kunene, M. C. (2014): Life cycle assessment of the production of xanthate salts and of their application for ARD mitigation, University of Cape Town;GENDORF Chemical Park
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: literature values, collected monthly average in 2011, average data.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.
